description:
Overview

TrustPoint HCM is a leading provider of Human Capital Management (HCM), Payroll, and Timekeeping solutions. We specialize in helping businesses of all sizes streamline their HR and payroll processes, improve employee management, and enhance workforce productivity. Our technology platforms and dedicated team support clients across the USA.

As the Business Development Manager for TrustPoint, you will play a crucial role in driving new clients and revenue growth for all products and services offered by our Company. Under the President’s direction, you will be responsible for identifying and cultivating relationships with potential new clients. Your goals and variable compensation will be based on expanding our client and revenue base.

Responsibilities

How You Will Make an Impact
• Prospecting & Lead Generation – Identify and target potential customers that meet our ICP (Ideal Customer Profile) through market research, cold calling, and other lead generation techniques.
• Consultative Selling – As you engage with prospects, understanding their needs as it relates to the services offered by TrustPoint. This would include gathering and documenting information into our CRM platform such as current vendor(s) they are working with, their pain points, things that are most important to them when they consider switching vendors. Based on the information you gather; the next step would be presenting TrustPoint solutions that meet their needs / stated requirements. Your ability to provide product demonstrations as well as articulating the unique benefits of our services is an important part of this role.
• Relationship Building – Knowing that the “Fortune is in the Follow Up,” we expect you to have proven experience in developing strong business relationships with prospects throughout the sales process. This could include forging relationships with influencers and referral sources as well. Your ability to organize and manage many active prospects is crucial, understanding that the sales cycle for some prospects could be one year or longer.
• Closing Sales – Handling brush-offs and objections leading to closed sales, bringing in new clients joining the roster of satisfied TrustPoint clients. Lead negotiations aligned with our pricing parameters. Meet or exceed agreed-upon revenue targets.
• Product Knowledge – Bring to the table knowledge of our industry and each of the services offered, those being HCM, Payroll, and Timekeeping. Remain up to date with industry trends, competitors, and pricing information gained from your prospect engagement.
• Collaboration – Work with the TrustPoint leadership team providing feedback and input on what is working, what is not, and ideas to meet revenue and new client goals.

Qualifications

What You Need to Succeed
• Proven record in B2B sales in the HCM, Payroll, and Timekeeping industry required.
• Strong understanding of HR and payroll processes.
• Strong communication, prospect management, negotiation, and presentation skills.
• Driven, self-motivated, and results oriented.
• Ability to work independently.
• Experience with CRM platforms, email, and other prospecting tools such as LinkedIn.
• TrustPoint uses ZOHO, experience with this CRM would be an added plus!
• Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or a related field.

Our Benefits
• Competitive base salary and variable compensation (commissions & bonuses).
• Comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare, dental, and retirement plan.
• Ongoing training and professional development.
• Hybrid work – although you are welcome to work in our Exton, PA office, we expect weekly in-office meetings with the balance of your time working remotely at your option.
• Access to the CEO and leadership team at TrustPoint, each available to assist with helping you win at your role in sales!

OMNI is honored to be retained in this search. We appreciate your referrals to professionals who may have an interest in this outstanding opportunity. Formal interest accepted through the OMNI Executive Career Portal. Please direct all inquiries to:

OMNI Human Resource Management

Anna Robinson, Senior Consultant – arobinson@omnihrm.com | 913-653-8089

OMNI and our clients are Equal Opportunity Employers and seek diversity in candidates for employment. EEO Employer W/M/Vet/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.
